item.title: FCC Chairman Goes After His Predecessor's Internet Privacy Rules
item.description: February 24, 2017 - The new telecom chief is moving to halt one part of the sweeping rules for Internet service providers, which were passed last year in part based on "net neutrality" regulations.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - The new telecom chief is moving to halt one part of the sweeping rules for Internet service providers, which were passed last year in part based on "net neutrality" regulations. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/24/517050966/fcc-chairman-goes-after-his-predecessors-internet-privacy-rules

item.title: Trump Administration Weighs Increased Scrutiny Of Refugees' Social Media
item.description: February 24, 2017 - The Obama administration began checking social media accounts of prospective Syrian refugees more than a year ago. Such steps could expand as President Trump prepares a new executive order on vetting.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - The Obama administration began checking social media accounts of prospective Syrian refugees more than a year ago. Such steps could expand as President Trump prepares a new executive order on vetting. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/02/24/516867413/trump-administration-weighs-increased-scrutiny-of-refugees-social-media

item.title: Google Spinoff Sues Uber, Saying Leader Of Autonomous Vehicle Unit Stole Key Designs
item.description: February 24, 2017 - Waymo, the company that began as Google's self-driving-car project, says a former manager "took extraordinary efforts to raid Waymo's design server and then conceal his activities."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - Waymo, the company that began as Google's self-driving-car project, says a former manager "took extraordinary efforts to raid Waymo's design server and then conceal his activities." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/24/517027719/google-spin-off-sues-uber-saying-leader-of-autonomous-vehicle-unit-stole-key-des

item.title: Liz Coleman: How Do We Teach College Students To Ask Big Questions?
item.description: February 24, 2017 - Former Bennington College President Liz Coleman believes higher education is overly-specialized & complacent. She says we need to encourage students to ask bigger questions and take more risks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - Former Bennington College President Liz Coleman believes higher education is overly-specialized & complacent. She says we need to encourage students to ask bigger questions and take more risks. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/24/516726045/liz-coleman-how-do-we-teach-college-students-to-ask-big-questions

item.title: Kevin Jones: Can Embracing Uncertainty Lead To Better Medicine?
item.description: February 24, 2017 - Sometimes, doctors just don't have the answers. Surgeon Kevin Jones says having the humility to acknowledge this leads to better medicine.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - Sometimes, doctors just don't have the answers. Surgeon Kevin Jones says having the humility to acknowledge this leads to better medicine. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/24/516710048/kevin-jones-can-embracing-uncertainty-lead-to-better-medicine

item.title: The Struggles Of Austin's Music Scene Mirror A Widened World
item.description: February 24, 2017 - As the face of Austin's music office prepares to depart, the city's problems and successes may offer a lesson for the world at large about globalization and technology.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - As the face of Austin's music office prepares to depart, the city's problems and successes may offer a lesson for the world at large about globalization and technology. http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/02/24/516904340/the-struggles-of-austins-music-scene-mirror-a-widened-world

item.title: Reading The Game: Shadow Of Mordor
item.description: February 24, 2017 - As part of our occasional series on storytelling in video games, we're looking at a game where the story fails: Shadow of Mordor, which won awards for its gameplay, but lacks a compelling narrative.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 24, 2017 - As part of our occasional series on storytelling in video games, we're looking at a game where the story fails: Shadow of Mordor, which won awards for its gameplay, but lacks a compelling narrative. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/02/24/515685000/reading-the-game-shadow-of-mordor

item.title: WATCH: In The War Between Tigers And Drone, Chalk One Up For Tigers
item.description: February 23, 2017 - Sure they might be chubby — to put it charitably — but they're still tigers. And when Chinese zookeepers mobilized a drone to get them some exercise, the big cats had little trouble bringing it down.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 23, 2017 - Sure they might be chubby — to put it charitably — but they're still tigers. And when Chinese zookeepers mobilized a drone to get them some exercise, the big cats had little trouble bringing it down. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/23/516845664/watch-in-the-war-between-tigers-and-drone-chalk-one-up-for-tigers

item.title: Go To College, Play Video Games. E-Sports Make A Play For The Big Ten
item.description: February 23, 2017 - There's no prize money involved, although League of Legends maker Riot Games offers scholarships for the e-sports teams at Ohio State and competitors at other Big Ten campuses.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 23, 2017 - There's no prize money involved, although League of Legends maker Riot Games offers scholarships for the e-sports teams at Ohio State and competitors at other Big Ten campuses. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/02/23/515853132/go-to-college-play-video-games-e-sports-make-a-play-for-the-big-ten

item.title: Should Scientists March? U.S. Researchers Still Debating Pros And Cons
item.description: February 23, 2017 - A "March for Science" is set for April 22 in Washington, D.C., to show support for evidence-based public policy. But some worry the march will be seen as partisan, and may even undermine sound policy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 23, 2017 - A "March for Science" is set for April 22 in Washington, D.C., to show support for evidence-based public policy. But some worry the march will be seen as partisan, and may even undermine sound policy. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/23/515584634/should-scientists-march-u-s-researchers-still-debating-pros-and-cons

item.title: After Making History In Space, Mae Jemison Works To Prime Future Scientists
item.description: February 22, 2017 - For the first African-American woman in space, her path to spaceflight and beyond includes trying to pave the way for more girls of color to follow in her footsteps.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 22, 2017 - For the first African-American woman in space, her path to spaceflight and beyond includes trying to pave the way for more girls of color to follow in her footsteps. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/22/516695456/after-making-history-in-space-mae-jemison-works-to-prime-future-scientists

item.title: Are Cyborgs In Our Future? 'Homo Deus' Author Thinks So
item.description: February 21, 2017 - Yuval Noah Harari expects we'll soon engineer our bodies in the same way we design products. "I think in general medicine ... will switch from healing the sick to upgrading the healthy," he says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - Yuval Noah Harari expects we'll soon engineer our bodies in the same way we design products. "I think in general medicine ... will switch from healing the sick to upgrading the healthy," he says. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/21/516484639/are-cyborgs-in-our-future-homo-deus-author-thinks-so

item.title: Uber Orders Investigation Into Sexual Harassment Claims
item.description: February 20, 2017 - A former engineer for the ride-hailing app Uber published a blog post this weekend claiming that she faced sexual harassment while working at the company. Uber says it's investigating the allegations.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - A former engineer for the ride-hailing app Uber published a blog post this weekend claiming that she faced sexual harassment while working at the company. Uber says it's investigating the allegations. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/20/516292319/uber-orders-investigation-into-sexual-harassment-claims

item.title: '#Republic' Author Describes How Social Media Hurts Democracy
item.description: February 20, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers speaks to Cass Sunstein about his new book, #Republic: Divided Democracy in the Age of Social Media. He says democracy needs people to come across a variety of viewpoints, and much of social media limits that exposure.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers speaks to Cass Sunstein about his new book, #Republic: Divided Democracy in the Age of Social Media. He says democracy needs people to come across a variety of viewpoints, and much of social media limits that exposure. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/20/516292286/-republic-author-describes-how-social-media-hurts-democracy

item.title: Uber Will Investigate Sexual Harassment Claims By Engineer
item.description: February 20, 2017 - Uber's CEO has ordered an investigation into a sexual harassment claim made by a female engineer after she published a blog post detailing her experience.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - Uber's CEO has ordered an investigation into a sexual harassment claim made by a female engineer after she published a blog post detailing her experience. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/20/516260638/uber-will-investigate-sexual-harassment-claims-by-engineer
